legal_basis: officer of the court owes a duty to respect and enforce court orders
decision_reasoning: technical breach in good faith may still constitute contempt but can be mitigated in sentencing
application_details: Mr. Hughes disclosed material believing it was not confidential under the order, committing an error of law shared by the trial judge
conclusion_outcome: guilty of contempt but granted a discharge with a reduced cost penalty of $15,000
cause_of_action: Disclosure of allegedly non-confidential material contrary to a protective order
procedure_steps: Initial acquittal, appeal confirming legal error, final determination of guilt with mitigated penalty
